original_text:
Climate change is one of the most pressing challenges of our time. The scientific consensus is clear: human activities are driving global warming at an unprecedented rate.

The impacts are already visible worldwide. Rising sea levels threaten coastal communities, extreme weather events are becoming more frequent and severe, and ecosystems are struggling to adapt to rapid environmental changes.

Despite the urgency, progress on climate action remains insufficient. Many nations have set ambitious targets for emissions reductions, but implementation lags behind commitments. The gap between rhetoric and reality continues to widen, putting future generations at risk.
